page.title: 14Scotton/Northorpe Government
page.content: District & Parish Councils Both villages are in Forest Ward, West Lindsey, represented by Mrs Eminson of Northorpe, an independent who regrets the intrusion of party politics into the District Council. These have no role in the 2 parish councils.Each has 7 members elections being every 4 yrs; each elects its own chairman and vice -chairman annually (in Scotton the agreed term of office is 1 year, in Northorpe 2).Scotton has a paid clerk. Meetings are held monthly in Scotton, every other month in Northorpe; 4-5 members of the public attend Scotton meetings as observers, 35-40 come to the Open Annual Parish Meeting in May. Matters discussed include planning, finance, rights of way, stubble burning, road maintenance and (in Scotton) allotments, speed limits, a gas supply and land for a play area.
